Frankly\, the story has been polarizing largely because it takes risks and is not afraid to make the player feel uncomfortable. The writing is solid and holds up completely to the first game. As someone who loves good storytelling in video games\, this is an experience you cannot miss. If you can\, it's worth trying to experience this game without any of the spoilers. This story is as much about the execution as it is the plot.The gameplay is tense\, fluid and strategic. There is a good mix of different human and zombie enemies\, and you can either sneak or fight your way through a situation. It makes noticeable incremental improvements on the first game\, while not changing what works. Sometimes the looting can get a little bit repetitive. I would say the game is perhaps a bit longer than it needs to be.There is a great low-guitar score\, top quality voice acting\, and the environments are gorgeous. Post-apocalyptic Seattle is rendered with beautiful weather and very realistic details. Having been to the city\, I was surprised how familiar they made it.This game is not going to be an easygoing experience with cartoon-happy endings. It depicts a dark\, ugly\, violent post-apocalypse in a very human way.But forget what reviews on the internet say - this is a narrative you need to experience for yourself\, with as few spoilers as possible.
